channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel’s Strikes in Beirut Brings the Once-Bustling Suburbs to a Standstill
item.description: Airstrikes targeting members of Hezbollah have brought the Dahiya neighborhoods south of Beirut to a standstill, its residents fleeing and businesses ...

item.title: WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert’s job is a delicate balancing act as the league soars in popularity
item.description: The league is caught in a messy middle between booming interest and its relatively small business.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Expands Evacuation Warnings in Southern Lebanon
item.description: The Israeli military told residents of more than 20 towns and villages to leave, a sign that its invasion could be expanding. The death toll in an Isr...

item.title: The Whiskey Industry Is Bracing for a Trade War if Trump Wins. It’s Not Alone.
item.description: Business owners and foreign governments are preparing for high tariffs and trade disruptions, depending on the outcome of the election.

item.title: Rich Americans prefer Harris over Trump—but want a second passport no matter who wins
item.description: Gaining residency or citizenship abroad is a "political statement" for wealthy Americans.

item.title: Harold Daggett, Port Strike Leader, Seeks Big Raises for Dockworkers
item.description: Harold J. Daggett is seeking big raises for longshoremen on the East and Gulf Coasts who have fallen behind workers on the West Coast.

item.title: Mexican Military Fatally Shoots Six Migrants
item.description: The country’s defense ministry said the military officers who opened fire might have mistaken the migrants for cartel members.

item.title: The Whiskey Industry Is Bracing for a Trade War if Trump Wins. It’s Not Alone.
item.description: Business owners and foreign governments are preparing for high tariffs and trade disruptions, depending on the outcome of the election.

item.title: Europe Expected to Approve Higher Tariffs on Electric Cars From China
item.description: The European Union is expected to support wielding tariffs on electric vehicles made in China, seeking to prevent unfair competition.

item.title: Boomers are the wealthiest generation that’s ever lived—and millennials are the ‘biggest losers’ thanks to economic crises
item.description: "Even with the same savings behavior, no generation can match the wealth accumulation enjoyed by the Baby Boomers."

item.title: WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert is leading the league to historic highs. Critics wonder if she’s fully seizing the moment
item.description: As the WNBA's banner season wraps up, Engelbert faces more pressure than ever.

item.title: BBVA plans Visa-backed stablecoin launch in 2025
item.description: The Spanish bank is pushing further into the blockchain space through a partnership with the payments giant.
